website_summaries.verdict: If you have a small wood-filling job to complete, you'll find that this product and its handy tube are up for the task.
pros: Comes in a tube that makes it practical for filling just a few small imperfections like nail holes
Can be squeezed directly into small areas
Sets up fairly fast and dries firm
cons: Once opened, this product has a tendency to dry out quickly, and become difficult to squeeze out of the tube

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect? No, nothing matches perfectly when the subject is wood... Better than seeing the 500 year old ring pulls on the center of the cabinets? Absolutely 😅🙌🏼. Just couldn’t live with them. Could not! I used this stainable wood filler then the furniture marker set. I filled the holes with paper towel 😳, so I wouldn’t waste too much filler. Worked out perfectly! Waiting on my new (modern 😁🙏🏼) cabinet handles and varnish to arrive so the “shine” matches a little better but very happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: V. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Grainy and unusable
customer_reviews.text: I buy this all the time at my local hardware store and it's fine. This was NOT the same... it was big time GRAINY. And no return/exhange policy? Not right if product is opened and defective within a certain amt of time. I opened within 16 days of receiving.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Old, caked up, hardened
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item with intent to cover up some small brad nail heads, after shaking and trying to get product mixed up, to my surprise after cutting tip and testing on sample board all that came out was water. It appeared the majority of substance was caked up. After attempting for some time to get a good mixture and come out in a uniform manner, did not work and had to end up using another product for my project. Did not work for my needs and would not recommend to anyone to buy this item. This is reason for giving a one star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: Not a good experience
customer_reviews.text: Vendor must be buying outdated tubes, hard to squeeze out with two hands and a large opening.
customer_reviews.author: rich info

customer_reviews.title: Not for large projects.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased Elmers wood filler at Walmart that I loved. This was the same brand and the photo and the actual tube looked the same. It is NOT the same! The other was smoother, more pliable and not at all like this. The color and texture were completely different. I was in the middle of a project so decided to just use it. I should have returned it. Sorry about the bad review.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: In a pinch, this stuff works really well. I will say since the last time I used their wood filler, it does seem a bit on the dryer side even directly out of the tube. You get very little play time with it before it starts to harden and crumble.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Vance

customer_reviews.title: Good wood filler for personal woodworking project
customer_reviews.text: I like that this product actually works - and has filled cracks in an old branch I am turning into a bird house. I also appreciate that it can be stained. My only challenge was that upon opening the tube, I had to get my partner to use his added strength to get the stream of putty moving out of the tube. Once started, easy and fluid to the end. Used the whole tube!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Becomes runny after a very short time.
customer_reviews.text: It works well but do your best to mix it before after use. This isn't an easy thing to do because of the tube it's in but it separates and becomes very watery after a short amount of time in storage. The day it arrived it was nice and thick and worked perfectly, when I went to use it again about a month later it was so watery I made a big mess at first. It wasn't until I squeezed out all the water filler and got back to the thick stuff that I was able to use it again. As long as you keep that in mind it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Condon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Filling Cabinet Holes
customer_reviews.text: Adding larger hardware to our cabinets and this wood filler worked great to fill in cabinet holes. I used wood stain markers to match our stain and it turned out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: moonbaby4885

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do the job...
customer_reviews.text: My deck was being invaded by carpenter bees. I needed a way to plug up the various holes, and after a cursory research of wood fillers, went with this one. It did the job. The wood-filling was done a month ago, and we've had a lot of extreme weather (heat, humidity, torrential rain) in the meantime. The filler is holding up well, and no return infestation by the bees. For the record, I haven't attempted to stain the filled areas.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Dabbler

customer_reviews.title: Not combined well
customer_reviews.text: When I first started using this it was super runny. No matter how much I tried to squish the container to combine it, it had separated. I couldn’t do anything with the liquid. Then it was so grainy. Hard to squeeze out, hard to keep where I wanted it. It shrunk when dried and I’d have to start again. I was using it was small indents in a piece of furniture. I wouldn’t not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: CTKR

customer_reviews.title: Working well for patching small spots
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to patch a couple of sizable dings in a couple of doors. I can't say that it is ultra easy to spread, but it IS covering the area that I want to cover and it helps that I can level it out somewhat with the lid of the tube. The tube is easy to squeeze and the filler comes out slow enough that you won't have too much in the spot. It appears to sand evenly, but I have not yet tried to paint over it. That's the next step.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Ryker

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill a 'divot' in an old pinball machine playfield. It sanded down smoothly, and accepted paint without incident...MUCH better for 'fine' work than the old chunky stuff that comes in a can.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected overall good product
customer_reviews.text: I only give 4 stars because the tube was kind difficult to use. I love the tube idea for filling holes on furniture but it was hard to get out of the tube, so I hope I can use the product until it’s entirely gone with out having issues. Bottle was also a bit pricey for how small the tube is.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but not very stainable
customer_reviews.text: Works well at filling wood and dries quickly. I like this product well enough, but there are two drawbacks for me. One, the material is granular and doesn't look much like any natural wood pattern. The color is basically the color of pine or something similar, but with dark granules mixed in. Two, this doesn't stain well at all. You can definitely see what is filler and what is natural wood. I have bought a total of three of these altogether since I only use the filler for repairing rough work such as mars on a bench saw stand I built. I'd buy something else if I were looking for something that would closely match the wood I'm filling.
customer_reviews.author: kmrobinson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy sandable paintable wood filler
customer_reviews.text: Did the job well, work fast as it dries quickly, sands well while remaining sturdy, paintable. I used it to repair the bottom of an exterior wood door. Prepped the door, applied the product, hand sanded then belt sanded and painted. Door looks almost brand new. Like most paint type jobs key is in the preparation!!!
customer_reviews.author: jjp

customer_reviews.title: Awful all around, zero redeemable qualities
customer_reviews.text: Leaks, grains up, busted open on one upper corner upon squeezing to apply it, it's useless and worthless. Just awful. -10.
customer_reviews.author: L.D.

customer_reviews.title: Will not stain
customer_reviews.text: Expected a name brand like Elmer's to work better especially with the high ratings. It filled the void just fine but went I went to put a walnut oil stain on the repair it would not take. I tried it a second time and let it sit overnight. Buffed it out the next day and the stain wiped off.
customer_reviews.author: Money Miser

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost - the tube doesn't seal properly
customer_reviews.text: This worked reasonably well the first time I applied it, though it is pretty hard to squeeze out of tube, even with the tip cut to about 1/4”. Went to use it 3 days later only to find that the well closed cap didn’t keep it from curing in the tip. Picked it out with a toothpick and was able to get a little out, but clearly this container just doesn’t seal well enough. One use for $8 isn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AJ C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The worst wood filler I ever used. It is grainy, not easy to spread and really bad. On top of that it is almost impossible to squeeze out anything from the tube. Essentially, I have used about 20% of the content before I trow it away. Total waste of money and time,
customer_reviews.author: IDI

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for filling
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite wood-filler thus far. It actually does stain well with whatever you’re using. The fact that it comes in a tube means that it’s not prone to drying out like other mini tubs of filler I’ve used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works great!
customer_reviews.text: This glue hardens like wood just as it says. I have an ottoman that needed to be fixed. One of the peg holes underneath had been stripped too much. So I decided to refill the hole with this Elmer's filler glue and re-drill the hole. I was skeptical that it would hold hard enough, but after it dried it felt harder than the wood that was already there!
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: no strong odor
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the Elmers Wood Filler having an odor but no issues. Used it on my door and it worked fine until it started to rain. Then everything falls apart. Tried again and it did not work. So learn from my mistake
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I drilled a hole too big for a drawer knob and it wouldn’t fit. I got this stuff and filled in the hole and redrilled to the correct size. Now the knob fits great and I can easily open the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: cash

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy This
customer_reviews.text: It does not work. This is a terrible scratch filler. It is incredibly difficult to get it to come out and it doesn’t actually blend well. The only good thing is that it came out easily, which also indicates that it doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Dearnys

customer_reviews.title: Filled holes.
customer_reviews.text: Well long story short. Got handles for my cabinets. Husband put handles on. Needed hole filler afterwards. Yep, this works good. Wish, my husband's measuring worked as good as this filler.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, drys fast, sands well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I like it for small projects, it hardens super fast so you’re project isn’t On hold, for small holes and dings it’s ready to sand in 10-15 mins. It’s good for larger gaps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy.Mcg

customer_reviews.title: Apparently dried out. Can't squeeze out of tube.
customer_reviews.text: I received one from Amazon two weeks ago. Worked fine, and as advertised. Ordered two more. Can't get the stuff out of the tube in either one. Apparently dried out and past shelf life. Useless. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: James Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply but didn't take stain well.
customer_reviews.text: It took stain so poorly that I had to mix dark stain with varnish to get a uniform color. That was not my plan - I wanted a more natural looking finish with a light coat of stain.
customer_reviews.author: J. Otero

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform well, don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t perform as listed. Definitely didn’t take stain well. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: S A

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product worked exactly as described. I was pleased I could easily fill in the wood and paint over it once the filler dried. I can’t tell there was a hole at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected. Difficult to get out of the tube.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say that I would recommend this product. It was hard and dry in the tube. Not sure if it is supposed to be like that or if it was an old item. Had to cut off the entire tip and stick in an awl to get any out of the tube. I was able to fill the one small crack I wanted it for. It stayed in and sanded smooth. Took stain but not even close to the color of the wood. Consistency is like damp powdery sand.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great Filler
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. So versatile for wood projects and hides all the flaws that my lack of ability creates. Stains like wood and painting over it is even better. Wouldn't use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: JKinGA

customer_reviews.title: Dried Out Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I must have received a bad batch. Even when it was new it was difficult to spread or fill holes.
customer_reviews.author: Dotti

customer_reviews.title: Stainable wood filler
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for me. I used this to repair two cracks in my kitchen table. Filled cracks...let dry...sanded down....stained to match and reapplied top coats. It absorbed the stain well and you can't tell it was repaired. The excess stored well and I was able to use it several weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: J. Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable and runny or too thick
customer_reviews.text: No matter how much you knead it, it will run out, then come out too thick. Didn't match my pine too well.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Took stain very well
customer_reviews.text: I hadn’t done much woodworking that I needed to fill in a long time. I was impressed that this took stain much better that the old stuff we used back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: Miles B. Free

customer_reviews.title: Smell/small holes with backing
customer_reviews.text: For very small holes and then s terrible smell until it cures. Better not use inside.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Not the wood filler I am used to
customer_reviews.text: It was clumpy and grainier than I am used to. Had to over fill a fair amount more than I am accustomed top and then sand it down.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D (Dallas, TX)

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: I needed to reattach some seating snaps in my wood chairs. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This stuff sucks. I could barely squeeze any out of the tube. It was all stuck at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Lolli.Lovegood

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I found this rocker on the side of the road. The rocker arm was broken. After nailing it back together I need a wood full for a couple of spaces. Worked great and was easy to use. Also you can stain it.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. I would suggest a small putty knife to help spread evenly. It dries pretty quickly so be quick otherwise it wont adhere very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mikki

customer_reviews.title: This will be my brand
customer_reviews.text: Hardened quickly, sanded smoothly, & accepted stain very well. What more can you want.
customer_reviews.author: Haywire

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I used a little, I guess I really didn't need it though. Floor wasn't deep enough scratches for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent batch of wood filler
customer_reviews.text: I've not been considerably happy with Elmer's wood filler in the past, but I needed something for exterior use that was both paintable and stainable. I'm now on my fourth tube and I could not be happier with the results. This wood filler performs better than expected. Once dry it forms a strong, dense fill that sands well to match surrounding surface levels. Paint adheres as per regular wood. Staining isn't so great as it tends to be lighter than regular wood, however, touch up with darker stain will remedy this problem. I'm hoping future batches of this product are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony K Wells

customer_reviews.title: "stainable"
customer_reviews.text: It says stainable but I disagree. Could not match original stain with the same stain used for everything else in my house. It does fill in cracks though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to stain
customer_reviews.text: It keeps absorbing the stain. I've allowed to dry between applications. I'm going to try a darker stain. But, it drys to a nice hard wood like consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica M.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This made for a quick and easy fix of my damaged cabinets. Thanks Elmer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike DeMille

customer_reviews.title: Product works as I expectof  an Elmer's product
customer_reviews.text: And, I was especially pleased that the color just happened to match the surfaces it is meant to repair. Add a star!
customer_reviews.author: GerryB

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: used to fill in a crack in a wood dining table
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I use this for small projects. works great. easy to use and easy clean up. shrinks a tad when dry but I just add another layer. no biggie
customer_reviews.author: CG Veach

customer_reviews.title: Tube was hard before opened it
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I gave bad review is because bought 2 tubes. 1 must had hole in it because it was hard in tube
customer_reviews.author: Long

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with, high-quality bonding, beautiful for multilayer buildup, best ROI!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work with, high-quality bonding, beautiful for multilayer buildup, best ROI! Extremely satisfied. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Solaris Lover

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: It works well on most of the items I have used it for but sometimes I have trouble getting it out of the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Asa Walker

customer_reviews.title: Wood filler
customer_reviews.text: Filled in the gaps quite nicely and with little effort or product.
customer_reviews.author: Redline

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but I'll use a different product next time.
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this product. It got the job done, but wasn't the best. It took a few tries before it covered a small area and moat of it rubbed off while attempting to smooth it out like the directions instruct you to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Snowball

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Stuff works really good, does exactly what its meant to do
customer_reviews.author: Boo Radley

customer_reviews.title: washable
customer_reviews.text: best part, unlike other brands i have tried, you can wipe off excess before it dries or soaks in for a cleaner look
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great for filling holes, hiding mistakes, all kinds of things.
customer_reviews.author: valeri roose

customer_reviews.title: Overall did the job but there are far better versions. I will stick to making my own
customer_reviews.text: It was separated and watery and almost impossible to mix in the tube. Very gritty and would come out liquid or chunky. Overall did the job but there are far better versions. I will stick to making my own.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Too dry
customer_reviews.text: Hard to squeeze out of the bottle. It came out dry and flaked as soon as I put in on the wood. It's also not "stainable" as claimed. You can easily tell the difference on where it was applied.
customer_reviews.author: Tammi

customer_reviews.title: It holds a screw
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to fill a small hole and that would hold a screw. I know nothing about this sort of thing so after doing some reading I took a chance on this. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wood filler
customer_reviews.text: Great wood filler. Screw on cap to save for later use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: bond is good and sands well
customer_reviews.text: I found that the saw dust they use is to chunky for patching nail holes or small cracks. Dries quick, bond is good and sands well. Mix glue with stain before applying .
customer_reviews.author: Rich R.

customer_reviews.title: My product busted open at the top when I went ...
customer_reviews.text: My product busted open at the top when I went to use it. Had to throw away after using once because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good filler
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts about this, thought the stain would look bad. It definitely stains darker than the wood, but it looks like a knot. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems to take stain pretty good.I used dark walnut stain that is oil based on a gun stock.Keep adding stain until you get the color you want.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G.

customer_reviews.title: Fills fine, does not stain.
customer_reviews.text: Wood filler doesn't have a good history of being stainable, but this one certainly doesn't accept any color despite being labeled as "stainable". Spreads and fills fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable product
customer_reviews.text: Good product - have used for many years.sandable and can be primed and painted with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Duff

customer_reviews.title: Great wood filler. Durable and sands well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good wood filler. Some spackles are just too light and some dry too hard. This one is sort of in between. It is durable but still easy to sand. I'm glad I have this now as I have several wood fixes to do.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, won't dry out if you only need it  sparingly.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, won't dry out if you only need it sparingly. I do not need filler often and its nice to be able to have it on hand in a squeezable tube which keeps it from drying out over long periods of sporadic use. This is the way to go for the occasional woodworker. It does hold stain, but it will be obvious in most cases that is not part of the grain.
customer_reviews.author: theman

customer_reviews.title: doesn't take a stain
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I bought this with high expectations only to find out after using it to repair a hole in the top of a vintage dresser that it does not take a stain very well and looks quite terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried most wood fillers and this is one of the best if not the best.
customer_reviews.author: ds

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Used to fill cracks from weather in my chainsaw bear
customer_reviews.author: Dave4047

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: saved me a trip to the hardware store, works well
customer_reviews.author: james luksch

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to apply, fills in great. Used on fence that we accidentally screwed gate lock into wrong and had to reattach in a different place.
customer_reviews.author: bab

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work to fix my screw hole
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be used to fix a screw hole that became too wide. I put it in the hole and left it to dry, tried to screw in the screw the next day but it didn't hold.
customer_reviews.author: Aitee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold stain
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold the stain very well at all. Had to use a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bosse

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. It's got a thick texture and dries ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. It's got a thick texture and dries pretty hard. I've used it for a number of small repairs on my run-down apartment, doors and hinges and nail-holes. It fills 'em all neatly. I doubt it's a permanent fix for rotted-out wood but, so far, it's been managing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product works as stated on the packaging. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Cold Grey Goose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my pine wood table, I had no trouble staining it. It was easy to use and it held the staining well.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Bought holes and big dents on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Bought holes and big dents on a wood desk. Filled them in with this and sanded it out to smooth it and you cannot notice there was something there. Fills in perfectly and absorbs varnish very well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: a picture fell from my wall and chipped my molding. I used this and painted over it and you can't even tell.
customer_reviews.author: K Robinson

customer_reviews.title: was excellent. it may be stainable
customer_reviews.text: Dry style filler, but once set, was excellent. it may be stainable, but that does not mean it absorbs stain the same as the wood
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This wood filler is a good product and works like it is suppose to It is a little difficult to apply but once you get the hang of it, it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: It helped fix some very light door damage, landlord will never know...
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works, kind of
customer_reviews.text: It's decent. Seems like it absorbs some of the stain, even when it is dry. Can be tricky putting multiple coats on while trying to match up the color of the stained wood I drove the screws through in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: jts

customer_reviews.title: It's Wood Glue
customer_reviews.text: Does what its supposed to. Works well and stains well.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: handy wood filler
customer_reviews.text: used to patch gaps in constructing a doll house. sands and stains well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fills Holes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fill some holes in a piece of furniture I bought. I think it worked very well and sanded down very easily once it was dry.
customer_reviews.author: Cher B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Stains well cover up crack and holes. Great price
customer_reviews.author: amy hanus

customer_reviews.title: Nicely stained and filled woodpecker holes well!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, slight stain difference if you know where to look. We had to repair multiple holes in our cedar pillars on our front porch created from the pesky woodpecker!! Overall, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of covering up blemishes. Stain goes on without filler showing. Fine product
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard wood filler I am using on my outdoor fence. It works well and is helping to get my fence back to its former glory. Its easy to apply and it drys pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: let it set and you can easily sand off the rough finish
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. let it set and you can easily sand off the rough finish. The furniture looks great again with a little touch up paint.Drys fast.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: as described...
customer_reviews.text: The wood filler dried as expected and was easy to sand smooth. I used it with treated lumber so I cannot say how it takes stain yet.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the project I was working on. Easy to use and easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Glasslover84

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works great to fasten
customer_reviews.text: I am noe looking for more wood projects to fix/glue or stabilize. This stuff works great to fasten, cover up, repair you wood problems.
customer_reviews.author: dherberg

customer_reviews.title: Does not look at all like wood without stain
customer_reviews.text: Does not look at all like wood without stain. Will have a chance to use it in another project coming up, but don't plan on using this for already stained wood (ie floors or existing cabinets), it will stand out! I have not had a chance to sand it yet either, but I applied to to our floor with a putty knife and didn't need to sand anything.
customer_reviews.author: j_e_h

product_meta.title: Elmer's E887Q Stainable Wood Filler, 3.25-Ounce
product_meta.description:
Elmer's E887Q Stainable Wood Filler, 3.25-Ounce

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Now the outside is as strong as the inside. From floorboards to sideboards, Elmer's wood fillers are easy to identify by usage, application and color.
feature_bullets: Contains real wood fibers for superior sanding, staining and painting
Can be used with high speed sanders
Resealable tube great for small jobs
